sentence:
Which sentence is the cause of "The boy's hands were shaking."? Choose one between A and B.
A: He planned to ask the girl out.
B: His palms were cold and sweaty.

label: A
sentence:
Which sentence is the cause of "The window was opaque."? Choose one between A and B.
A: The glass was stained.
B: The blinds were open.

label: B
sentence:

A: Her bike swerved.
B: Her bike sped up.

label: A
sentence:
Which sentence is the effect of "The group overlooked the woman's faux pas."? Choose one between A and B.
A: The woman was relieved.
B: The woman apologized.

A: She renovated her kitchen.
B: She adopted a cat.

label: B

Which sentence is the effect of "The boaters set off a flare."? Choose one between A and B.
A: Their boat drifted to shore.
B: Their boat was rescued.

A: I made photocopies of them.
B: I put them into alphabetical order.

Which sentence is the effect of "The man went into denial about the tragedy."? Choose one between A and B.
A: He got over it easily.
B: He refused to talk about it.
